result.execSummary:
The defendant Austin Riley Cain was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Austin Riley Cain is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Austin Riley Cain was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Submit DNA sample and pay costs.  *Payment Plan:  $50/month, commencing in May.  
*If after 6 months the defendant has paid the fine, costs & surcharge in full and has had no criminal violations, the defendant may petition the court for Expungement under 973.015.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Austin Riley Cain

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Subject in Custody per Sheriff's Dept. - MASO
Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Austin Riley Cain in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.  Atty Hendee has no objection to expunge after 6 months with conditions.  Atty Gumz agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

Atty Hendee asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.
Atty Gumz makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 1:  Pay fine and costs = $442.00
  DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing in May
Defendant needs to appear for booking today.
  If after 6 months the defendant has paid the fine, costs & surcharge in full and has had no criminal violations, the defendant may petition the court for Expungement 973.015.

Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that booking was to be completed back on January 21st but has not done so.  Atty Gumz spoke with his client a couple times this week and will follow-up on the booking.  Atty Gumz states that the defendant had trouble getting a ride here today.  Atty Gumz asks for a plea date.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Plea/Sentencing
Booking needs to be completed on or before April 7th by 4:30pm.
bond continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Austin Riley Cain in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz requests 1 further reset to find an AODA office where client lives.
BY THE COURT:  Reset.  Bond continued.  Return date scheduled for March 3, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that this was called earlier however, Atty Gumz now represents the defendant.  Atty Hendee withdraws his request for a warrant and the traffic tickets being defaulted.
BY THE COURT:  Warrant quashed; Traffic tickets will reopen.

Atty Gumz agrees.    Atty Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Gumz enters a Not Guilty plea.
Atty Gumz states that the defendant is aware of appearing for booking and signing a bond.
Court finds probable cause.

BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea entered.
Set for Return.
**DEFENDANT NEEDS TO APPEAR FOR BOOKING AND SIGNING THE BOND AT THE MARQUETTE COUNTY SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT BY THE END OF BUSINESS OF JANUARY 21, 2016.  Return date scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Austin Riley Cain not in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15TR1832 & 1833 tracking:
  Atty Hendee requests warrant based on defendant's failure to appear.    Atty Hendee asks for a default of both traffic tickets.

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue.  Both traffic tickets will be found in default; forfietures will be entered.
